WWiqjroYSOZuaMHZo8PkaQ.text: As always good food but very bad service. They have very little chicken in their bowl and I ordered 4 bowls togo. They just put like 4 to 5 pieces on each bowl as there was no chicken. I told to put some more but they were charging me for double chicken.

iY2iT699sK_9sjjU6XyLSw.text: I've eaten at a lot of Chipotles in California and I never reviewed them because they were so common.  I'll make an exception for Charlotte :)  Chipotle is a winning concept - fresh and accessible.  It gives you a pseudo healthy feeling and options (if you really want to be healthy).  It is not at all authentic, but it is tasty.  The assembly line, Subway-esque, made-to-order line works.  The menu is simple, choose your entree (burrito, bowl, taco) and your protein, the rest is entirely up to you.  I recommend the burrito bowl with tortillas on the side (so much food and this way you can wrap what you can't eat) or the tacos (3 to an order).  Their carnitas (shredded pork) is always moist.  I'm not a fan of their chicken, which has a fake smoked flavor.  Pile on plenty of corn salsa (the best!), a bit of sour cream and lettuce and you are good to go.  Seating at Chipotles is always kind of uncomfortable, varnished plywood and steel doesn't make for comfy seating.  Get it to go and have a meal for two days if you get the burrito bowl.

gxQTrGeVfi_EOrtjvCQPMw.text: A burrito a day kept the ramen away when I was an undergrad in California. Not only was Chipotle delicious, but also a great value.   Yet, as I keep coming to this location, I keep being underwhelmed.   Burritos, once $5ish, are now in the $6-7 range.  That $1.75 plastic cup of  guacamole, once bursting at the seams, is now filled by an air bubble (this isn't a bag of chips!!!)  The chips seem stale and not as lemony-salty as they should be.  The chicken is usually a miss, being over-seasoned and over-cooked.  My final straw was getting a part of a plastic bag along with my barbacoa o, which I discovered in my mouth. Yum.    I still love Chipotle, but this location needs to improve its quality if you expect people to pay your increasing prices. I'll be back to check, but I am not going to hold my breath.

2sS_YVtD570VAnA-_U92dg.text: Chipotle is awesome; however this is the single worst location I have ever been to, which is why the rating is so low. I eat at chipotle all the time, but will never ever go back to this location.   Food: The staff (which are quite nice at least) never manage to make a decent taco. For example, everytime I order tacos with salsa, they put a dot in the middle of the taco, and I either have to ask them to correct it, or spread it on the taco myself. They also give maybe 50% of the meat any other Chipotle does. I would think a chain wouldn't vary this much with the amount of food you receive, but obviously that assumption would be wrong.   Interior: Interior is terrible as well. All the tables are so close to each other it is impossible to not be enveloped in other peoples conversations. I often can hear the people sitting at the table next to me louder than the person across from me at my own table. Not because they are so loud, but because the tables are set up so poorly that I'm actually closer to them than the person I'm eating with!! Oh and the seating also holds like 1/10th of the people who come in on the average lunch. You might get lucky, but don't expect to be able to get a table the vast majority of the time at lunch.  Parking: Parking is absolutely terrible. The parking lot is tiny tiny tiny, spots are all small (which means very very often people park over the dividing line), and you'll often see people parking down the street in the apartment complex, or at the shopping center beside Chipotle. Horrible planning.   Staff: Can't complain about the staff. Granted, they can't make a decent taco to save their life, but they are always generally polite and nice.

jTMNWQrgWTwIIK-5nLAQXg.text: I went back recently to see if they got their Sofritas and Chicken containers separated. For a while they were separated as a result of my initial complaints against them, but now their Sofritas (tofu) is right next to their chicken. It needs to be next to the vegetables and away from all meats so that no chicken will get into the Vegan Sofritas containers. Us Vegans don't want to eat meat! They also need to move the guacamole away from the cheese because Vegans don't eat cheese! They've accidentally spilled cheese and chicken into vegetable product containers. This has happened at this particular Chipotle location and several others I've been To around Charlotte. They also need to stop being sloppy in their food preparation!

JRdC1_retRfJgIu2mlYcZg.text: As a chain restaurant and slightly on the edge of being called fast food, I really enjoy Chipotle!   The food is fresh and delicious! Chipotle has a philosophy for their products, "Food with integrity." They offer vegetarian options and naturally raised and hormone free meat options. It makes me feel good about not just eating delicious and a lot of it, but also from a company that is trying to be environmentally friendly. On each cup there is a story about one of their products or how they do something in the company...it's fun to read.   The staff there are very friendly! I was a bit surprised at how helpful and friendly they were as I was going down the assembly line for my burrito. It has indoor and outdoor seating to suit all types as well. You can even order online so it's ready when you get there.  Great food and great service! I'm a fan.

s1hM7z9Ha60yVNZz5DJzwg.text: I used to really like Chipotle and really enjoyed their salads better than other competitors. Beyond that, I loved how it was a good no-brainer quick lunch when I forget to plan ahead.  But as of the last year, it seems every time I go in for a chicken salad, the chicken (and sometimes fajita veggies) is completely charred and they forget to give me the dressing that follows the salad along the assembly line. I don't know what they're doing with the dressing or if the bagger is a magician on the side but I swear they put it in and then I get back to the office and it's not in there. Ugh! I'm not going to drive back for Pete's sake so then I'm stuck with a burned, bland salad. Shame on me for not checking every. single. time. Now I do but I'm a slow learner. But I also have converted from an almost weekly customer to a once every 4 months visitor. Can we go into a time machine to 2014 when your food was always good? Of course the positive that came out of the E Coli scare is it's a lot easier to find a parking space in the precarious parking lot full of aggressive burrito zombies!

RhsG9ke1tfNbGutWuSaLmg.text: This is by far the slowest Chipotle ever. Thursday night at 8:00 they have 6 ppl in the kitchen but only two line prep people. The line has gone to the door.

p9xZPHMadtwXc64mDN8rWA.text: Chipotle is one of the chain restaurants I like. It's better than Moes in my opinion. I always get the barbacoa burrito. It fills me up. Outdoor seating is nice. I flick the begging birdies grains of rice and it makes them happy.

0fia-ed7ICVI9k3b27dJag.text: Chipotle is my latest fast (yet healthy) food stop!  There are no bells and whistles to the Chipotle atmosphere but this location is clean and spacious.  Parking is around back for those of you who are new.  I recently visited during pique dinner hour and I was dismayed at a long line.  I was, however, pleasantly surprised at how quickly the staff kept things moving.  The food has always been good - not amazing but never disappointing.  I'm also a supporter of Chipotle as a company because they put effort into purchasing meats/produce from ethical and sustainable farms.  They are also very vegetarian friendly for those of you who opt out of eating meat.    I'd give Chipotle 3.5 stars.  I'd definitely head back, but wouldn't go out of my way to get there.

al0ylt6QRm61q5H5oUJSRg.text: This is odd... When I lived in California I would avoid this chain as in SD we had so many outstanding Mexican restaurants and stands.   But since I've relocated to the QC I crave Chipotle. This is the closet place I can at least enjoy Mexican food. The whole beans are what keeps me coming back - D-lish  Their beans are whole, as they should be-not a mushed up mess of re-fried crap with fillers, their rice is fluffy and with great cilantro flavor. The chicken is tasty, moist and tender. I usually get the salad (sans dressing as it is caloric!) and get a side of one of their yummy salsas for dressing.   So until a real Mexican establishment finds its way to Charlotte, I will stick with you my new friend. Thank you.

hzO7utZuLMtiJ3blsHBrPQ.text: I can't believe I tried Chipotle for the 1st time recently. Got the Barbacoa bowl with guacomole. Fantastic!! Got it for takeout. Delicious. I will be going back and often!!

ClZUJ3tn_khzBclsNM0mjA.text: This place is a good solid burrito place.  With a nice selection, but not too complicated, I can order and get my eat AND drink on (as they serve beer too).    Much better than individual places that claim to be SO good (i.e. Phat or Johnny Burrito) Staff is fast and you are in and out in no time.  Add in a nice little patio area to watch traffic go flying by *grin* this is a nice little place to add a few inches to your waist line *wink*.

b2MDkreow-ABFthoFG8Hhw.text: I'm a bit obsessed with Chipotle and was incredibly excited when one finally opened in Dilworth (now they just need a location in Uptown). I first fell in love with Chipotle in Minneapolis 10 years ago. It's just simple, good, fast food.   Given all the Chipotles I've visited and burritos I've eaten over the past decade, I used to be frustrated with the South Boulevard location. Some of the employees weren't nice and they hadn't really mastered the art of rolling a burrito. But things have improved greatly there.   I'm pretty loyal to the chicken burrito bol, but everything there is good. If you're trying to keep things healthier, go for a salad and avoid the sour cream and cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

suTNBGxO5B6_Tqpzi6VRKQ.text: I've eaten here before, but today's visit was terrible. I was using up a gift card, and first wanted a carnitas burrito. Looking at how the meat looked (poor), I decided to go with the steak. My general complaint is the presentation of the food in the containers, and then the presentation of the food put together was poor. The server asked what ingredients I wanted, and they were just placed on top of each other. She did not know how to fold the flour tortilla, like folding paper. I also had some guacamole and it was bland. I brought it home, and added salt, pepper, cayenne, lemon juice, and chopped garlic. So much better. I don't expect the food to be "authentic" mexican at Chipolte, but at least offer the food as appetizing. Give me some of your TLC.

hTsDUPuMZWFXh_bVI8WuyQ.text: Chipotle if you were a child and I your parent I would have to say " You really disappointed me this time"   I felt like your prices seemed so reasonable $5 for a burrito and then BAM you screw the Guacamole lover...come on $1.75 for freaking Guacamole on your burrito? Really!? When I balked at the price I was told "avocados are expensive" - ok, yes, they are about a dollar a piece- so I am buying the equivalent of two avocados??? I don't think so.   You do not have ground beef? Wow...what the heck so now I am paying $8 for the same burrito I get at Salsaritas for $5 and now I cannot even have the type of meat I prefer? Man. So I went with the marinaded chicken. Lets just say I am glad I went and splurged the almost two dollars for Guac because that chicken was way overly seasoned - and way too spicy.   I will say the burrito was very large - so if you don't like Guac then $5 is a rocking deal. Also, I preferred the rice to other establishments. Unfortunately due to my preference for all things Guacamole I wont be coming back.   Please Salsaritas- invest in an uptown location ...(they do not have frivolous upcharges : ) )

X9UonxKmE4Lw-rc504apXQ.text: My husband has totally converted me to a Chipotle-lover.  It doesn't hurt that this little place is a hop, skip, and a jump away, but the more often I go there, the more I find myself going back.  There are days, I find, when all that will satisfy me is a big burrito stuffed with fajita veggies, beans, cheese, and dollops of hot salsa.  I really, really, really love their fajita veggies.  They are inspirational.  I don't eat fast food a lot, but when I do, it's generally Chipotle.

ar0brosbeOGJesi6_pcslA.text: I kid you not, this Chipotle has some of the nicest staff around. So happy go lucky making burritos, taco salads and the like.   Every time I roll into this Chipotle I'm impressed with the super clean facilities, exceptionally nice folks behind and counter and, let's be real, their burritos have yet to let me down. Massivo barbacoa burrito bowl, pinto beans, rice, cheese, sour cream, lettuce medium salsa, if you're askin'. Super fresh and, frankly, Chipotle does a nice job of sourcing sustainable ingredients from their suppliers. Check their website if you don't believe me.   My only gripe is that they charge $1.75 for guacamole (on your burrito or as a side). That's pretty steep, amigo...especially because I love me some guacamole. But besides that little hiccup, this Chipotle makes me happy with solid burritos and fantastic, friendly service.

jSQ31k8r5zYMQTPR6XW6_Q.text: Fatty steak in the steak tacos. Toppings tossed on sloppily to bury the shells under a mound. $12 bucks for some mediocre lunch tacos... Me thinks not.

WtZ4OXJkqNd9h9s2lc0VSg.text: Just tried this place for the 1st time yesterday and was really happy with their meat (I chose chicken), but sad at the lack of options - no jalepenos? Shame! But my salad was good and tasted fresh & healthy. I'll go back, but only if there's no Moe's around!  PS: Moe's gives you chips and salsa bar - this place you gotta pay big bucks for chips and a tiny thing of salsa - NOT COOL!

G6qvZjLNqr_zUGGXlH0sfg.text: Chipolte, where Love and Food are One....  Love.  That's the first thing that comes to mind when I think of Chipotle.  Not only the love that I have for this establishment and company as a whole, but the love that is put into each and every burrito I've ever eaten from Chipotle.  I've been to this particular Chipotle about three or four times, and I have never been let down.  I would also like to mention that about once every other week, my gf brings me carryout from Chipotle. Thanks hun!!  I have never had a sub-par meal or Chipotle experience.  My go to is the grilled steak burrito.  I've been to burrito joints all over this town, from Qdoba, to Johnny Burrito to Salsaritas, and I've yet to taste steak that is on the same level as Chipotle.  Its tender, juicy and full of flavor.  I usually like to go with the black beans and all the fixins they can pile into one monster burrito.  I must mention their guacamole.  I'm always sure to add guac to my burrito.  I will say that there is a slight up charge to add guac but their guac is filled with such greeny goodness that the up charge it totally irrelevant!    Just about every time my gf and I go to Chipotle, we are sure to get an order of the chips and guac as a side item.  Not only are the chips always fresh and crisp, but you can never get to much of the guacamole from this place.  I mean do they fly the avocados in fresh daily from Mexico??    The service is always great here at Chipotle.  They are always quick and efficient.  My order has always been made exactly as I've requested.  The actual inside of the establishment is always clean and tidy.  So I guess its all a matter of what you LOVE in life?  If you LOVE good, tasty, filling, food, then there's really only one place to go, one place to fall in LOVE with - CHIPOTLE!

nYRZn3LzODtXH8j9b2X4RQ.text: The people and the food are a five but the parking and the seating is a 3 or less. Be prepared to wipe down your own table at busy times. To go is a much better play here if you can. Plus a burrito add guac ($1.85) chips and a drink is 12 bucks. Skip the chips and get a water, it's healthier anyway

c9QONpBzAtYw5eg0Vda6cg.text: Proud to eat at and support a business that is committed to a Non-Gmo menu! They offer healthy options while eating out at reasonable prices. My fav is the chicken fajita; I get it with lite brown rice, double black beans, chicken, fajita peppers and onions, guacamole and lots of Tabasco both red and green. Yum

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wouldn&#39;t that be nice!
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Really like the lime rice and naturally raised chicken

ca3IRJZSQjQZ2hWaAZL4Ag.text: I recently went to this Chipotle and not only got about half of the amount of chicken of a usual bowl, but got a piece of bone (or extremely hard fat) in it! Most locations are good, but this one underwhelmed.

uODP0j9CY_KdpMrVE5ZAKg.text: Parking is awful. Just get ready for that. However, don't let it deter you from a great burrito.   Lots of pretty sunlight in this location. Kind of OG in my book for Crown Town's Chipotle stops. Love it. Eat it frequently. Plus, I always enjoy the burps.   In fact, I think I'll go right now.

D3SAchSQmb-EzSBwosnmfA.text: Communication between the team is not the best at this location. What does that result in? Waiting on food that ran out about 10 minutes ago when there were no customers waiting on line to be served. This was stated by the team members themselves as I watched them discuss it for about 3 minutes before getting steak and fajita on the grill. Not the first time I had to sit and wait on food at this location. No sense of urgency seems to take place. Kind of sucks. The three stars also is a result of the overly seasoned fajitas I received before. It ruined my bowl completely. Way to salty. Other than that the team members always seem to have a smile on their faces and they're always very excited. They also took care of the issue. That I do appreciate.

TVqmFdS43E6yP7ebpgl-uQ.text: This place is a hoax!!!! Tried to charge me for a burrito on the side with cheese (not a quesadilla). Terrible service, same old chipotle ingredients. "Fresh" yet those gross black/pinto beans and brown/white rice were cooked in 1 minute!

X4bqr_HlIPH_VrAAIw3Bag.text: This was my first Chipotle experience.  Limited menu although lots of topping options. I ordered the vegetarian burrito bowl. Very big and guacamole is included! It was delicious! They even gave me a side of medium salsa without a charge.  Staff was very friendly, welcoming and accommodating! My only negative would be seating. Restaurant is small, but the tables are secured down so you had to share with others. I was by myself and got one end of a 6 top table while 2 women and a baby were at the other end.  I will definitely be back! If you are in the mood for a quick delicious Mexican meal, I highly recommend Chipotle!

6tDTmaICBoeeGDjwXfMFOQ.text: I decided to give this place a try because its literally a half block from my salon and the people at Mr.K start to remember my order since I eat there so much in one week. I absolutely regretted it. I remember Chipotle burrito was alway so massive which make me over eat due to not wanting to waste food. But I swore there's an option for regular size or small size burrito. Well I was wrong. I ordered the steak burrito. The guy behind the counter suggested adding cheese to it since the steaks are a little spicy. Umm I don't do spicy so I listen to him and add cheese.  What got me soo perturbed was that he was so busy flirting with me by asking me a ton of non related burrito questions that I feel like he man handle my food. He slap more than enough black beans on my burrito, throw very little cheese in, didn't distribute the ingredients evenly so when he tried to roll it, it tore apart. After he rolled it, saw the disgusted look on my face, ask if I refer a tortilla to be wrap OVER THE original burrito, meanwhile trying to tuck all the over flowing ingredients under the roll so I don't see it. Really??!!  Another employee saw my face, he tried to save the situation but its beyond saving.  The burrito was ok. It is spicy and the little cheese that was in there didn't help. I will definitely try Chipotle again. However, I will not go back to this location. I truly believe food should look pretty. We eat with our eyes first. But this didn't happen here.

FNn1i5NyZq9iw-4-pkmLlw.text: I am always a fan of chipotle. Its normally a good burrito done fast.  My go to order is:  Chicken Fajita Burrito - lettuce - corn - pico - And get their salad dressing mixed in with it.

LrQHCH-csJa5hQT8b-FR2w.text: I heart burritos that are the size of my dogs head, therefore, I love Chipotle! I am not a huge chain restaurant kinda chick but Chipotle is top notch for when I'm looking for a burrito. I love that they only offer burrito, salads and tacos and you aren't in menu overload and their barbacoa is just delish, I seriously don't know how they make it so tasty. Top that sucker with some beans, cheese and sour cream and I am all set. The place is very clean, modern and staff is quick to make a burrito and always so sweet. Another plus, they were playing The Killers when I went in this past time. Burrito and Brandon Flowers?? Bring it!  Also,  I don't know what they do to their soda but their Coca-Cola rivals McDonalds which has the best Coca-Cola in the world!!

h7zETkeWUGkciATYkMenTA.text: Good food. Bad customer service. I made an online order for pickup and when I drove all the way there they said my order was unavailable. I came there right on time and they haven't even bothered to call me or email me with the notice. I left without any food. The next time when I went to check my bank account and they had taken my money for the order. I called them and they said I could rearrange to pickup the food again. I did and they didn't even get the order right and forgot my salsa. Will not go to this location again.

Vv1AkXurgeF1GlDqsrMHWg.text: Worst Chipotle location I've ever been to.  Consistently rude and aloof employees and it takes FOREVER.  The South Park location is much more efficient and fast like most of the other locations I've been to.  Really need to invest in better employees and customer service here.

kO5wK-lJACNa1xIjwFBNvw.text: Whatever you do, do NOT go to this chipotle. Go to the one at metropolitan. This location has been graced with my business far too many times but never again. They never have the ingredients ready, so you wait 5 minutes for your meat, then by the time you sit down to eat, the whole thing is cold from sitting out waiting for the missing ingredients. The people that work there are a joke. Worst staff in Charlotte. They should fire everyone and bring over the staff from metropolitan to try and make it better. Disgrace to the chipotle reputation.

yp9BYvJgbLjQeBXvxYy9YA.text: I used to come to this location a lot (until they opened one up in South Park mall). I like the service here. The staff is super friendly and while it does get busy, I haven't had any issues there.   It does get busy and the parking here in horrendous.   But outside of that, what's not to like. Excellent burritos and burrito bowls, fresh ingredients, fresh guac, fresh chips, great salsas. The prices are also pretty reasonable too.   Chipotle is solid and it's consistent. It never disappoints.

G0Rd9Fh60b3c8BGhwdgIsA.text: A regular location, good service, great patio and views. Very convenient with parking always available.

OkniDFUa2bXue_RM5tu-aQ.text: This is the first group of staff that Is very hard working and fast. I've visited many Chipotles from multiple states and this is by far the one with the most hard working staff. When it's downtime they know how to have fun and be happy. It's not like people that hate going to work and give customers terrible service.

Ga3jNJEEhgcWtHELBy8upg.text: Friendly staff for the most part... I work near here so I've been to this location a few times. Haven't had a bad experience. Food is always fresh and there is no long wait time. Download the app to pick your order up quicker because it is hectic during the week around lunch time.

GbfULq6H46QdiClmTsg4IA.text: I honestly had to write this review solely based on the friendly staff-I can't even imagine what high standards the manager here must have but the staff is so freaking nice that I couldn't not give them props.   As a lifelong salesperson, I eat on the road often, well a lot, so I can pretty much tell you the nutrition facts of most chains, which led me here in the first place-4 stars!  Also, when I'm working from home, sometimes I just need to get out for a meal to see some other living, breathing people and this is where I go.  First, it's super quick, you can be in and out if here in no time! Second, it's healthy. All the food is made fresh, right behind the counter, and they are one of the few chains who use hormone/antibiotic free meat and organic produce when possible...hard to find today when everyone is trying to save a dime. Lastly, the staff always greets you with a smile, asks you about your day and says hello and goodbye (one thing this Philly girl never takes for granted).   So if you're looking for a quick and healthy meal, this is the place.  My two favs are the chicken burrito bowl and the crunchy tacos.

pmikeYfM2p-dtFPYjJBFHw.text: I love Chipotle I really do. I don't always come to this particular location but this is my first time at this store and my experience was horrible. The staff did not greet me, I felt rushed when I was adding my ingredients to my burrito and the young lady at the cash register was very rude when she took my payment. I understand that Chipotle is a growing company but I'm pretty sure that this corporation would not be please of they knew that customers were treated like this.

7LN7NiJFEiIaWYvn-xwNaQ.text: I definitely can do Chipotle once a week... on a good week, I can go there twice.   There has to be something said about doing simple things well, and Chipotle excels here.  Their menu and ingredients are simple and not too complex.  Sure, you may not get a variety, but at least they know what they are doing as far as what they do provide.    My usual go to is a chicken bowl, white rice, pinto beans, chicken, medium salsa, corn, guacamole, and lettuce.  When they are out of guac, I usually go the cheese route... but you can't go wrong.  Depending on if there is a line, (usually there is) you can get your food and be eating within 5min which is great.  This location has parking in the back - off of a busy South Blvd, I'm sure they are not hurting for business with all the other shops around this location.  Just be careful when you pull out of the parking lot due to the Chipotle food comma you WILL receive (it's just a matter of time).

VaLY1WgMc7LO1rw0GA9Xyw.text: Oh Chipotle, I love you so much.  My husband and I came here Sunday to grab a quick lunch. We usually get the salad bowls, however, we decided to split the burrito.  Steak, rice, blackbeans, cheese, salsa, corn, and guac (yes, it is extra but so worth it!). The burrito was HUGE. I was completely full after eating half of it. So glad we split.   Love coming here because of the fresh ingredients and options. Anyone that is doing the Whole 30 diet (God bless you), this place is heaven. The carnitas meat is Whole 30 approved and so is the lettuce, pico, corn, and guac!

g8cACIma7NTi7IcM8KrOQQ.text: Yes, Chipotle is everything it is cracked up to be and then some. I always feel like I'm eating a little bit healthier when I am here. Perhaps it is their commitment to reducing waste and recycling or their hormone free cheeses and meats.  As to their selection, yes it does seem a bit more limited than other "build-it-in-front-of-you" places which have different types of burritos and more salsas and toppings and nachos and that one where they shout at you as you enter that has a salsa bar.  Great staff. The girl who put the toppings on my burrito was super happy and really excited. I know that some of her enthusiasm rubbed off on me and improved what was already a good mood.  This is a small location with very few tables inside. If you're here during a busier time, expect to get friendly with someone as you share the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burrito (what&#39;s left of it)

K8mhhPnAeFHcNSNUQXNhng.text: The more I come back to Chipotle, the more I enjoy it, especially their burrito bowls.  Yes, their menu is still a bit limited but their ingredients are fresh and flavorful.    Typically I get the chicken burrito bowl with lots of hot salsa and I love their corn salsa.  The corn tastes like it's right off the cob.  They also offer brown rice as well.  I just avoid the chips and salsa and drink.  Indoor seating is limited so I usually get my food to go or eat on the patio if it is warmer.    And people smile here.  I couldn't help notice one of the employees has a beautiful smile. I'd come back just to see that again!

DbWUQoLi0u6v3eMMqXFLWw.text: Am I really writing a review for Chipotle right now? Yupp! I've tasted the fruits of Chipotle all over the United States. I've seen a range in quality and service. You might catch them on a good day...you might catch them on a bad day.   I came here the other week and I was quite impressed. I went with my usual burrito, except this time I was extremely hungry and  felt like I was up for a challenge. I loaded up on pretty much every add on they offered - the helpings were generous. I also went with double chicken. Make sure they scoop you're first serving of chicken before you ask for double meat. Don't let them compromise the size of each protein serving by speaking too soon.   I was prepared for a challenge and I was ready to take that burrito down. However, I was concerned that who ever had to wrap my burrito wouldn't be prepared for a challenge of their own...resulting in my burrito quickly become a burrito bowl.  Boy was I surprised...the young lady's burrito wrapping skills were exceptional..!! This woman had the hands of an angel. It took a few extra pieces of aluminum foil, but she got the job done! I wish I could shake her fathers hand and say, "well done sir"!  I can't promise that you guys will run into the same angel next time you guys stop in for a burrito at this particular location. But you happen to be in the area on a Thursday around 1pm, make sure you stop in. You might hit the jackpot, as I did!

hpLTCn-bOQRJ-U4_MenJWQ.text: What can I say? You pretty much know what you are going to get at Chipotle; fresh and yummy. My husband introduced me to the bowls. It's basically a burrito in a bowl, sans the tortilla. The chicken is my favorite but if you go with the veggie chofu, the guacamole is included. That's about 1.50ish if purchased alone. And yes, parking is a bit of a bear but not impossible.

_hn2PiJ0myPLBKxXYkfX5g.text: Rude poor customer service.  Food was not good at all.. packer and manager need training on customer service.

hOIxwWRriuYrU09Ma_UJiQ.text: I mean can we be serious for a second- as long as your server listen to you, piles on the food you wants and goes as fast as your heart desires... It's chipotle. I mean it's amazing .

D2mPKXIeGEBkA0R8egeVsw.text: Chipotle is seriously 1 of my top 5 of all time, but this location is...not. The customer service sucks and the attitudes here are horrible. This is the closest location to my house, but I'll gladly drive a few minutes further just to avoid all this in the future. Do better, South Blvd!

RBOEiou3E2Wck1ZoxtvBRA.text: Very quick with getting the line down.  They're like machines in there.  I've never had an issue with food quality, or customer service.  Don't let the lines fool you - they're soo fast here, you can get in a long line and find yourself near the front before you know it, even during a lunch break between clients!  Give them a shot.

kh9VI7Pg1H4k0o_Wnap8iA.text: Holy crap this location is dirty. The kitchen, the food prep area, the dining area. Everything's dirty and disorganized.  The straws are all wet, all the chairs are dingy and there's gum stuck to the backrest of the chair in front of me.

by--itHuYJ5B463j88siVA.text: I don't know why I haven't reviewed Chipotle till now.  We been going there pretty regularly recently, that is when the wife doesn't make dinner at home, chipotle makes it for us.   so now you know how often we go to Chipotle.  the cooks and servers working there are so kind, they give us those buy 1 get 1 free coupons once a while and now the rewards card, its super cool, already got one free burrito with the 4 purchases we made this month so far.   having said all this.  Food taste - I hardly had any complaints with respect to food quality or taste at chipotle, other than that one time when the rice was not fully cooked and the infamous E.Coli virus incident.   The portion size is just as you wish or just when you say 'stop' or '1 scoop is enough' or 'skip fajitas please' or something like that.  food tastes fresh, we usually get burrito bowls with either chicken or tofu. Chicken is awesome tasty and so is the hot salsa.  we usually don't buy chips and not sure about the chips.  overall the food is good, sumptuous, tasty and hopefully organic, non-GMO, non-MSG as they say in their website.

vJnNeBeyRswpTYnVp5fsvg.text: Chipotle gets three stars for the food but earns an extra one for being almost completely GMO free.  There is no soy, not even oil, in anything except for the tofu and even that is organic.  While most other assembly line burrito places have cut back on the nickel and diming, Chipotle still does it and it can get expensive quick.  They charge almost $2 for guacamole on a burrito and you only have the option of cheese or sour cream (you have to pay extra if you want both).  Add a drink onto that and you're looking at $13 dollars for a burrito, chips, and a drink.  The cheese is also mozzarella which just doesn't go well with burritos.  The rest of the add-ons are limited compared to other similar style places  The chicken is grilled fresh; however, the charred taste is too much and leaves it with a burnt flavor.  The place also needs a makeover.  While the sanitation grade is good, the soda fountain are a was a little messy and the floors were dirty and cracked.  The place could use a refresh to make it a little brighter.    I appreciate the non-GMO component of Chipotle, however I think the flavor of the food and the lack of fillings misses the mark slightly.

DW1t1uMFHjURe6Kh42Afvg.text: Seriously I love Chipotle! Fresh ingredients and simple choices make this place a top favorite for when I want something "healthy" that's not a salad.  I stopped in last night, the store was pretty empty which was a bonus for me, first class service. I got my usual, chicken bowl, add one spoonful of steak with all the fixings...seriously add all the toppings you have salsa, corn salsa, cheese, sour cream and lettuce and then add guacamole. Please and Thanks!  It was fast, the service was great and as usual my food tasted great.   Mmmm....Chipotle!

nJmEjMmTNH1U6qk6sCyfNw.text: I've tried Chipolte a few times) three at this one location) and I know it's not for me. Each time I've felt extremely rushed and overwhelmed with the ordering process and only once was my order correct. All three meals lacked flavor IMO and we're overpriced for what was received. I feel people like this more because of the convenient location to uptown and ability to get a different type of lunch fare based on the other options.

9CXMIdZii0A8wuGVIHUUMQ.text: 19 people in line and one cashier and one burrito maker. One manager in a back room and three on the grill. This place sucks to be considered fast.

0hdPsDtAf-3RrUnSJ2HEMQ.text: I'll start off by saying, I do love Chipotle. I've been to many different locations and the food quality has always been consistent. I can't give this location any more stars though. Something is wrong with the management.  The past two visits, something hasn't been ready or they've been out of an ingredient. The first trip, they were out of Pico and the second trip they were out of all tortillas...How can a burrito place be out of tortillas??? I don't get it? Out of all the Chipotle locations I've been to (probably ~10 or so), I've never had this happen. It's really disappointing driving to Chipotle and having them be out of something.

m19ydxyqxhubV_ftYMqBwg.text: I really like the food... but the management of the SouthEnd needs some work.  I eat here way too often. About three times out of four there's something not correct: out of a key ingredient (rice, beans, chicken, cheese... something basic) or something weird going on with the staff or management (unprofessional or just weird interactions). It wouldn't take much to make this location a great experience 99% of the time, instead of only 25% of the time.  **Since originally posting a two star review I have stopped eating Chipotle. And this deeply pains me. I can see why they were in the news for food born illnesses. Hygiene is just not a top priority. The foil lids were bring restocked up front, the worker took so many that the top one was braced with her face. Her face was touching the lid. I kept waiting for her to throw away the $.003 lid that was touching her face. I walked out of line when I saw it being used on a customer's order.

jYV2k3tR_PmLscat4AVxug.text: We come here often, for only one reason; the food. Tonight we had a less than exceptional experience. There were four people in line when we walked in, and it took close to 15 minutes for us to get to the front. It appeared as though one of the employees was training, right in the middle of the dinner rush. By the time we placed our order, we looked behind us and the line was out the door - nearly 15+ people were there and there was absolutely no urgency from the employees. They were messing around with each other and laughing, while their neglected patrons stood in line, patiently. I'm not saying a work environment has to be extremely strict, however, make sure your customers are taken care of first. Once we finally made it out of Chipotle and ate at home - our chicken was on fire - SO spicy. As I have said before, we come here often, and know how the chicken should taste (my tongue is still burning). Tonight we had a poor experience with the customer service AND the food. It would be nice if the management could take this matter into their hands and train their employees on the importance of urgency (especially during lunch/dinner rushes), etiquette, respect, attention to detail, work ethic, and communication. Until then, we'll be heading to a different location.

-sWjAqidb2BhtPs6u3uxsQ.text: Came in with my little brother because he surprisingly never had a burrito. He said he wanted a steak burrito. When we arrived there was a wait time on steak. The manager who was eating what seemed to be a late dinner stopped to give my brother and I complementary drinks. After our wait he called for us to place our order. To my surprise he told the cashier to comp our meal. Needless to say our late night burrito run turned into a little miracle. Might I add it was delicious! You can't beat quality customer service !!!!!

WOzih8zIoWFpF39YSRHtPA.text: The service was horrible via phone. Also, requested a few things through phone to which my request was still not fulfilled . Two days in a row they didn't include plastic utensils or napkins.

j76NEZnRmpeqqFpvb5AcJg.text: Went in on Sunday 8/26 mid-afternoon, there was a line but not too long. Every employee looked unhappy/angry. JnV5V129y8Kx9w1UDzqvtg.text: What can I say, I love Chipotle! It's a go-to place when you find a dish you enjoy. I wish they were closer to me in SC, their nearest location is still about 30 minutes away.  Chipotle is always fresh and delivers large portions that gives you the right amount of bang for your buck! Chips and guacamole is a good idea as well, so fresh and delicious!

hMtfuSeLrLEioqoaBRObTQ.text: There has been so much improvement in this location I no longer recognize the establishment from my previous review. Maybe when Chipotle did the mass hiring they got a wave of fresh energy? Maybe it is because I now sneak out of the office to take this thing called a "lunch break" and the afternoon crew is more chipper? Either way Chipotle - shut up and take my money.  Two major improvements have occurred in the last few months. First - they are no longer out of items. Perhaps my last review was the last of the supply chain issues because the delicious option bar has been well stocked since. Except for carnitas, but the news says no one in NC is servicing carnitas right now so they get a pass.  The second improvement is much more important to me - they strain the ingredients before packing up my burrito. That means NO MORE SOGGY BURRITOS. That's really all I ever want in life - a delicious fresh burrito without any liquid morphing the tortilla.   The thing I truly love about Chipotle and why I will take them above all other burrito joints (and I have branched out and tried a few!) is that they season their ingredients. Something so simple yet so few places do it. I swear the competition boils the chicken and rice and stuffs it in a burrito. That cilantro lime rice is the best and I normally pass on rice. The chicken retains the fresh grilled taste. And when you put this and many other things in a soft tortilla it is absolute perfection.

2sjiB1T6b9aAooQiYJHMeQ.text: The staff was extremely grumpy. The food was fair but not great. One of the female staff used the men's room.

CGwem1Pl3az0s_qvMH8WsQ.text: Although quite busy most of the time, I prefer this location and the one near Kings Drive as they're pretty friendly and quick.  Parking here is always a challenge, but I guess it's great for business, right?  The food is always fresh tasting and sooooo ADDICTIVE!  I'm the chicken bowl type of gal and I love the cilantro lime rice, chicken, pinto beans, fajita veggies, and corn salsa (and a side of guac).  I'm still trying to decide if I'm a fan of the queso addition though- TBD.  You can always skip the line by ordering on the app, which is a plus.

uLsz4LL8CtGnYTVKTY8swg.text: Chipotle rates high in my books. There's God, my husband, dog, family, then chipotle. But seriously. I love me some baby sized burritos.  I love going to this location because they always load it up. I got a veggie burrito once and I swear it was 10 lbs!   The food is delicious (that E. coli doesn't scare me), but I deducted a star for this spot because it sometimes can be a little dirty (the tables not cleaned), but overall this is my go-to joint since it's right down the street from me, aka the most convenient thing ever.

bKCwAp7IY13DMveIrF8gvw.text: Seems like each time I go here I kind of wish I didn't.  Here's what wasn't great this time: (1) Restaurant was dirty - Kitchen floor had trash on it, corners of the floors near the garbage can were dirty and clearly hadn't been mopped in a while. Stainless steel cabinets and counters were all pretty dirty and smudged. (2) They were out of some things - In particular - the peppers and onions.  They told me it would be ready and they'd bring me a little cup of it in about 5 minutes, but they never did. (3) Meat was dry and crusty - the chicken was fine, but the barbacoa was not. Definitely had been sitting out for a while. (4) Staff taking my order wasn't paying much attention - I had to keep repeating myself. I noticed a similar experience with the other customers. Chipotle is convenient and usually pretty fast.  There aren't many options like that in the immediate area near Atherton Mill. Once new restaurants pop up in South End I'm sure more people will go elsewhere.

dD0w3tzfdp2Cl-kjvRocUA.text: Went to eat here last Sunday and the food was cold and not prepared well. I live close in the area so this isn't the first time I've dealt with this. It's just been consistently shitty. I hate this chipotle so much I downloaded the yelp app just to write my first review on how this chipotle needs to get it together. The only good thing about this chipotle is that it's close to the one near target which has been always good. I'll be at the chipotle near target from now on.   The workers are either high or retarded, I'm trying to figure out which one but I think it's agreed they're just slow.

SYz_fVGpOjh43Mpok-tfxA.text: Consistently the worst experience. I do not understand. My husband and I went at 11 for lunch when they opened. Without a doubt, the chicken, rice and guacamole are from the night before. There was no corn salsa. There was a plastic container lid in the green salsa. After we went through the line, we watched a worker take a piece of chicken from the counter and put it back with the chicken to serve. And I just want to reiterate they had just opened for the day. It was filthy. We live very close so it's extremely convenient for us but more and more it's a terrible experience. Not only is the food questionable, the workers don't make you feel welcome. This used to be one of my favorite fast casual restaurants but I just cannot support this business any longer until something changes.

EUrRwO_WQHSV5EAJA7wCDQ.text: Ate lunch here with wife Saturday. Not much to say about Chipotle. They are sometimes hit and miss with the food it seems. Today was a hit, our bowls were pretty good.

z3YK0GixqMd7qOMhZNVStA.text: I'm not even sure that they deserve 1 star, but since my food was good I'll be fair. Having worked in customer service for 10 years and currently in sales management, I know a thing or two. One thing I know for certain is that the customer service at this location SUCKS!   -Two of the crew members were having an inappropriate conversation (something about lesbians) -The young lady that prepared my order did not greet me, just asked for my order...yes, uh hello to you too! -There was absolutely NO ORDER, crew members walking to and from the register with customers waiting and not saying anything.  -The icing on the cake was when I went up to the counter to ask for lids to put on my bowls. She tosses one on the counter "There's one." She goes to get the second one and I'm holding my hand out at this point because had she tossed that second one...I had to catch myself, you ALWAYS hand the customer what they asked for.   I'll never visit this location again, EVER. I liked coming here because I enjoy eating outside, but I won't spend my money where I can't even get decent service. Today totally turned me off ;(

LdrV9Lqu1nCjPAcusYtSfQ.text: OK so yesterday I went to the chipotle on S. Kings Dr. and if they didn't have any corn I repeat any corn! I was so upset but I still got to chipotle because I was like well maybe I can eat this without corn but to me it's like eating a potato without butter just can't do it. I called another Chipotle with 10 minutes to spare before I got there and I I asked if they had any corn and the lady answered the phone with so much grace and enthusiasm and she say yes we have some corn! She said I'm going to put two sides of corn to the side for you. As I was speeding down the highway to make it to the Chipotle before they close I ran it with four minutes to spare and she handed me my corn and I tried to give her some money she said no just write a good review on yelp all (hope that did get her in trouble) but you know. Here I am keeping my word. Thank you for the corn and I appreciate it.

9BmIUNjGh6zWCFaeuSKcWw.text: Every time I've ordered online from them they make a huge mistake. On 4 occasions there have been huge chunks of half avacado that are hard as rocks. Other times they forget drinks, they forget chips, they forget my extra guac, they forget entire burritos.   It's like their staff don't know how to read or they just don't care.

2Hvrx-2q2jerz2p8Dscn8w.text: The worst Chipotle location I have ever been to, hands down. The service is eh, the food is never ready & requires some kind of wait, & the line is always long (hmmm I wonder if this has to do with waiting for food....).   I stopped in around dinner time on a Thursday. First off, they were "out" of white rice. Last time I checked, being out of something means you don't have it at all. Staff then tells me it'll be 10 minutes, so I opt for brown rice. I'm going down the line & everything is all dandy until they tell me once again that they are "out" of guacamole. I think to myself hmm they don't have any guacamole in the entire building. I'm a little pissed at this point because I order a veggie bowl for the guacamole. I'm contemplating about leaving my food, but my husband has already paid. The staff member all of a sudden states that the guacamole will be done in 10 minutes, oh wait it's actually 6 minutes, but 6 minutes go by with no guacamole. I know, I'm a little confused too. Is it 10 minutes or 6 minutes? 10 minutes go by with no guacamole. Another 5 minutes & no guacamole. I end up walking out.   This place is a joke. I honestly can't believe they are still in business. Worst customer service & worst experience I've ever had at a Chipotle. I know it's a chain, but c'mon. This is just embarrassing. I will NEVER be back to this location.

Our previous order my boyfriends burrito was half the size and my salad the lettuce was soggy.   Will never visit this chipotle again.

9D3q0zQBjcK5lpMBgqt4fQ.text: If you're on the Daniel Fast like myself, Chipotle is a great stop that provides everything that you can have while on the fast. V0REJMkix3cVwBbQl6R4Dg.text: We came here at 9:00 pm (store closing at 10) and the store was out of everything and they refused to refill anything (including white rice, beans, pico, guac, cheese, etc). The fact that this chipotle was actually still charging customers for food when they were out of everything is incredulous. We will never return to this Chipotle, and our group is so disappointed by this experience.

xl0TXzByRXr8mcLnEo1BOw.text: The absolute worse chipotle experience ever! I dine at chipotle closer to my residence and I see why. Why is there 5 ppl on the line and the only person listening is the cashier. Every last person except the Male cashier needs to be retrained. I hardly got any fajita vegetables on my bowl and after telling the server  she still didn't do it...someone else tossed a couple pieces on my food. The last server on the line that had the nerve to tell the cashier not to tell her what I needed has a serious attitude problem. I ordered two bowls and needed condiments for both and she had the audacity to look at me and roll her eyes. I will NEVER order, purchase, even recommend this location to anyone. Next time you think about hiring children to run a business. DON'T! I'm extremely disappointed and now have to make up for the missing items in my meal at home.

iSRrT5yl0PAuk9AFOiY1Nw.text: You'd like that being a chain, all Chipotle is the same, right? Well, you'd be dead wrong. This is without a doubt a worst Chipotle location I've ever been too. It's so bad, in fact, that is has pretty much turned me anti-Chipotle and I neverrrrrr want to go to (here, or any other location). I know, GASP, the horror. Seriously, it's that bad here.  e.v.e.r.y. time I say, F*** it, I'll give it another show, I'm quickly reminded why I need to listen to my gut. The other night was no different. I show up and halfheartedly wait in line. Tell the first nice line worker my order, and he starts to plate up. It seems like they give you less and less protein with each visit. Either that, or this guy just wasn't feeling it that day. Not even that, I got the skimpiest amount of fajita veggies imaginable. I digress ... and keep moving down the line. My wife and I try to finalize our bowl but topping it with lettuce, they guy tells us they're "out of lettuce". I had to have heard correctly and said, "you're out of lettuce. Are you serious? Just go open another bag...". He replied "yes, out of lettuce, it'll be about 10 minutes on that". ARE YOU *^$#*$^# KIDDING ME? 10 minutes on lettuce that is probably already pre-bagged and ready to go? Whatever, bro. Move on down to the cashier and go to pay and ask for our chips + queso. My already annoyed face was met with "Oh, we're actually out of chips right now. It'll be at least 15 more minutes. And we're out of queso". Once again, ARE YOU *^$#*$^# KIDDING ME?  Chipotle has probably the easiest menu of any 'fast food/casual' restaurant. They've got only but a few options, and most of which come ready to go for them. I literally watched one of the cooks pour the black beans from a giant plastic bag out of the refrigerator into a pan on the stove to heat up. My point with this ramble is that with so few items to cook/prepare, how do you run out of g*d damn chips. The ONE and ONLY side 'dish' on the menu. And should could have cared less for the 'inconvenience'. You have one job, Chipotle. And you fail at it e.v.e.r.y single time. They're always out of something. This location seriously needs new management who knows how to properly train it's staff into how to maintain the food prep line.  TL;DR. They're ALWAYS out of something. Call it the ice cream from McDonald's, because the Chipotle machine is always down for repair.

pClFf9Lrg6qFXVs8rLsc6g.text: There were a multitude of problems encountered at this location. First they were out of tortillas at 6:30 pm on a Monday night. By the way they were telling customers it seemed like they had been out for quite a while. Customers could only get a bowl or a taco but who knows how many taco sized tortillas they had. To make matters worse with the bowl, they were also out of forks and only had spoons. I've never seen spoons at a chipotle before but based on the workers' responses this seemed normal, even though the silverware containers were labeled as forks and not spoons. Lastly, our order of chips did not look, nor taste like chips from chipotle should. They were much smaller and extremely stale and I'm pretty sure they were actually from Taco Bell, in which case I could've walked down the road and gotten myself the same amount of chips for half the price. I can't believe management has allowed this quality of food and service to be served at this location.

YloyJdLu-7PkUwx-l0L4hw.text: This place is ridiculous . They are always understaffed and don't respect the people that are ordering food in person and they never apologize .

4esFEd8S8Bx0uwBBZ30mwQ.text: The best Chipotle in Charlotte. They're not cheap with the food, super friendly and it's in a great location. The line between 12-2pm is crazy but that's to be expected since that's lunch time for the South End crowd. You'll more than likely find yourself sitting next to a complete stranger but hey strike up a conversation and enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Water does a body good
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Bowl with the works...minutes the sour cream and lettuce

tlDWRP50ZdSVAbO-WbTsHg.text: I had a catering issue with a different location and they would not answer their phone to correct their mistake. I tried calling over 10 times. I called the next closest location - 2109 South blvd- they answered on the 1st try! I explained my problem to India, the order was late and missing items and cannot get in touch with the other store. She was so great- after hearing me out, she apologized and jumped in her car and brought the missing items straight to my office. I thought that was Exceptional customer service! She was great, she clearly didnt have to do anything as it wasnt her store who screwed up- but she did and I had to write this review because she saved the day!! And while I will not use the other location anymore, I definitely will still do Chipotle from that location! Thank you so much India!! You rock!!

om8sqLl3XcPNQWP5Jk9gxQ.text: My favorite place. I love everything about it. It was busy during lunch but the line moved really fast. The parking lot was jammed as well. Don't give up though, It is all worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. chicken bowl with salad dressing

q3NeWHfM_kboezcphdKthA.text: Super hit or miss. 4/5 times we've gone here the chicken is ridiculously, unedibly salty

kZBNGGgE05mG0iPjPGBh6Q.text: I really like Chipotle but they have gotten skimpier and skimpier every time I go. I remember when guac was like 1.50 extra or something and they heaped it on, now it's $2.05 and you get a dollop it's a bit ridiculous. Anytime you ask for them to put more of something on they act like "more" means two more pieces. I always have to ask for more fajita veggies but they never seem to get it. It's frustrating.

mTyd0qXIA4edT51vDeoqMw.text: Apparently burrito and bowl are the same fucking thing. And they wouldn't even refund my money, gtfo

3zvu2r2AJSPDPUnkodoqNA.text: They need serious training at this location. Very inconsistent and slow on the line. Portions are never right.

LVecbjqfgz7KHOn9bcrQbQ.text: I like this place because it is animal friendly.  All of the animals used in their burritos are treated fairly and they aren't raised in cages.  Remember that you are what you put in your body, and this place does the body right.  The food is scrumptious and the hot sauce burnt my tongue, oh yeah baby.

EksCG49YrHw9BxpY2qGTBw.text: Chipotle just opened several locations near where I live, so I decided to give them a try.  I'm glad I did because they are really good.  Very fresh ingredients, the tortillas were soft and chewy, the lettuce was crisp, the salsa was hot, but not too hot, and the meat was savory, tender, with a unique and pleasant texture.  I threw some guac on top to make my tacos complete, and I was a happy camper.  For about the same price as a Moe's or Qdoba, Chipotle offers a much higher quality meal.  I was very impressed and will definitely be going back.  I had the tacos with shredded beef, and also tried a couple of bites of my girlfriends chicken burrito...she got the hot salsa on hers, and baby ...it was hot!  But still good, fresh tortillas, great ingredients.  If you're in the mood for Mexican, give Chipotle a try.

E_myedT47TOL630VijuBHw.text: so, I decided to give chipotle another chance. Service was good, people friendly... but,  every chunk of chicken in my burrito was wicked gristly. I guess if I go here again, its gotta be vegetarian

RezaLaU7ztl52UxR8d1w7g.text: Their chicken is fully of fatty pieces. They're good, but they're nothing spectacular. You can get chips and a drink and much better salsa at Salsaritas.

3G5rH8sWTv4S_bgKWfYcww.text: I really like the burritos at Chipotle. The barbacoa is an excellent combination of both tender and spicy. I like that I can order online and pick up my food at the register. I hate standing in line, and the line at Chipotle can get really long at peak times. The guacamole is also excellent, unless it's browning (more on that below).   Lately, however, I've been annoyed with the service. I always order a burrito and chips with guacamole online, but when I pick it up at the register, they just hand me a burrito. I hate having to look through my bag and hand it back to them. Also, the guacamole I've been getting has turned brown! In my mind, that means it's not fresh. If I'm paying $3 for guacamole, I want to be able to eat it without scraping brown chunks out of it. For these two reasons, I'm giving Chipotle 3 stars.

IZHBCXy0wuUlDQlgoUCnUQ.text: The staff is very friendly and the food is very good for the price. The reason I have not given this restaurant 5 stars is because of the LOUD, stupid music that is always playing. It is often so loud that it's hard to have a conversation when I'm eating lunch with a friend. If you ask the staff to lower the music they often will oblige the customer, but I've gotten to the point that I will only go into the restaurant for take out since I CAN'T STAND THE LOUD, SILLY MUSIC.

BgWblbrOvXuVlSlbSy9Uhw.text: Chipotle is the best! Get the burrito bowl, with lots of toppings. And if you like spicy, you can't live without the Smokey Chipotle Tabasco sause on top!

Lfjcor9FzzY9BfEMhIQW1A.text: Yummy food, felt like a chain. Staff were very polite but definitely just another numbered customer. Would recommend the burrito. Very delicious.

BU-dBcyBowFycwnMGhJ0Xw.text: Yipppeeeeeeeeee!!  I found a Chipotle near uptown.. This place is the greatest "fast food" in the world.  The burritos are massive and the quality of food is optimal.  Not to mention, the speed of service is off the charts.  They have found a way to maximize speed without negatively effecting quality.  Take a break and make a stop at this Chipotle.  mmmmm mmmmmm. Enjoy!  -Ian M.

VUvn3GJP0eWcR0VnYLlEUQ.text: It's a chain, but it's cool. The staff at the South Blvd location are funny and outgoing. They make standing in line for 5 minutes fun if that's possible. Barbacoa beef is awesome and it's my only choice when I go there. Add a little cilantro rice, pinto beans, cheese, corn & tomato salsa and a dash of sour cream...heaven! The size of the burrito is well worth the $6.25!   Dear Chiplote...I'll see you again soon!

0hfnqCGrO6xpPmQYlhfplg.text: Chipotle oh Chipotle. What can I say? I love, love, love LOVE Chipotle. No matter what state you're in, you can always rely on Chipotle. Many restaurants (many, not all) offer organic meats and veggies.   One downside that isn't really a downside: Picking up multiple orders is a chore, because it's cafeteria style ordering/burrito making. Best bet is to fax or complete your order online. Have I mentioned that I love Chipotle?  They have a signature cilantro lime rice that is quite tasty. All of the meats are fabulous. For meats: Carne (steak), barbacoa (shredded beef), Chicken (chicken) and Carnitas (roasted pork). Pinto (whole not refried) and Black Beans are also tasty.  Phat Burrito is pretty good too, but Chipotle takes the cake for me. I'll take Chipotle over Moes, Qdoba or Salsaritas ANY day. It always taste much fresher than any other burrito place. For those of you who are hesitant to try Chipotle, you won't be disappointed.   Suggestion: Chicken Burrito w/rice, Black beans, Corn salsa, pico de gallo and hot salsa. Bam! That's the winner right there.  BTW have I mentioned that I love Chipotle?

AiRlMR_OHjy3Stat4QYnZQ.text: Worst Chipotle ever. Carnitas in a big hunk not nicely shredded like other locations. Gauc had a half an avocado not even cut up which would be fine if I could get knife but apparently that's too much to ask. Also out of iced tea and the staff acts like you're bothering them when asking for these basics. I love Chipolte but will never go to this location again.

ecQHUTJbkCXxBqj9uXRL5g.text: Wisconsin Ave in DC was the first place/ time I ate at a Chipotle.  Primarily because it was a perfect place for lunch, located near a project I was working on and served healthy food, if you order correctly.  I ate there 3 times a week, so I must like it.    Anyway, I am happy to see that Charlotte finally has one in the area.  The place is fast food, which I normally avoid.  McDonald's formerly owned Chipotle with a majority investment in the chain, but do not let that discourage you as based on the quality at every other fast food Mexican place (e.g. Taco-Hell, Salsa-really-not, and even Moe's--which is not that bad) -- Chipotle is the Champ (Flaming Amy's in Raleigh bests it as that place is just cool).  They grill everything fresh and have an option for you health nuts called the Burrito Bowl, basically burrito ingredients sans the flour tortilla.    The location on South Blvd fit what I excepted, as do most chains.  You order what you want on your burrito/ burrito bowl from beans, to meat (chicken, steak - lean steak, pork), to fresh vegetable toppings.  This is done ala Subway order line.  So, by the time you reach the end your food is ready to go.  I recommend getting a side of salsa and chips.  The chips can feed two and they are seasoned with Sea salt (I think) and Lime.  It is a great fast food place.  Likes - . Lean steak . Fresh ingredients . Salt & Lime Chips . Healthy eating . Burrito Bowl  Dislikes- . Chain  . None near Cornelius

IbAL9AOnJyX2knMF0RayAw.text: The food here is consistent and the place looks clean, can't ask for much more.  I usually end up with the chicken, sometimes the pork..both are good.  I like that they have corn.  I wish Chipotle would add one more thing to their topping options, but I'm not exactly sure what.  Maybe jalapenos?  I'm not sure, but if someone from Chipotle corporate happens to read this I am happy to help you figure this out.  Holler.

IU6cUtfU3gRzLkpGDqzuMg.text: The service has improved over the last few months and I have to say I'm eating here alot more. I thought I'd go out of my way for a re-review.

GFJd97pyPplKinGMQn9CxA.text: I'll start by saying everyone pronounces this place incorrectly, & it irks me to no avail. Without the accent mark, it's just Chi po tull...not Chi pote lay...if that at all makes any sense. So until they add the appropriate accent to their logo, I'll continue to say it how it should be said...not how the company inappropriately wants it to be called. Anyways, I'm not a huge fan of this quick tex mex burrito joint. To me, there are several other places in Charlotte that are much better for getting the same thing.  The taste of their burritos just doesn't do it for me. Maybe it's in the onions or spice flavor of their chicken, but I just wasn't a huge fan of their burrito or their sauces. To me, it seemed like a lesser tasting burrito than many other places such as Qdoba, Moe's, or Phat Burrito.  Chipotle isn't one of my favorites & I'd rather go to several other places to get a tasty burrito.

KRLiK06W76jCwTRVHPhCoQ.text: Lots of very trashy reviewers in the Charlotte I see. Giving Chipotle 3.5 stars?!?! You're off your rockers. This place is 5 stars.

5Ayx_Xyw_YcfumbeZdMT4g.text: Is there really anything else that needs to be said about the healthiest, awesomest fast food out there. No didn't think so. Now go eat your chihuahua sized burrito..

YOj06KwIu90_n8OO6izuIw.text: The food is absolutely delicious and I love that much of it is locally grown and they are always conscious of their environmental impact. It's always so spotlessly clean and the staff is always friendly but depending on who is serving up the meat, your portion may vary. Sometimes I barely get any meat. I usually get the burrito but lately have been going for their soft shell tacos. I highly recommend the guacamole and chips. I get them often as an afternoon pick me up when working late. I don't usually eat there since the tables always seem to be taken but if you can get one the outdoor tables are nice.

mWRQkwPDrIW1EHiXGIEe8w.text: Staff is nice and they have a heavy hand with your toppings. Can't get better than that.

8v-ZgX3Gtq2CXR9-ub2vXg.text: DELICIOUS!!!  Friendly, fast, efficient staff!  loved the food.

7LP5qtI19TzWDSRNOa3KVg.text: "Food with Integrity" say it all! Highly recommend Chipotle to anyone looking for great tasting, fast and health concsious food!

vk-C6hy6JVPitbk70YP5AA.text: I love Chipotle and I frequent the restaurants. This particular location is the closest to my job so I can go on lunch, however it is also the worst location I've ever been to. Many of my friends have started driving to the further locations just because the service is terrible. 75% of the time I go, the meat is not ready and they tell me it'll be a 10 minute wait most of the time. Today, I spent 30 minutes in the location - that is far from "fast" food. They never apologize like most companies do if there is a wait and they tend to get frustrated with the customer over the situation. The location near the Target shopping center is a much better location, but it's also further. I wish that this location had the management and customer service that most other Chipotles have in the area. A simple "I apologize for the wait" would do wonders. Other locations often offer a free drink to people that are waiting and while I don't even find that necessary, it is very nice and makes the wait less frustrating when they are friendly about it. People may suggest to order ahead to avoid the issue and I did that for a long time, but every single time I would arrive at pick up time and they would tell me it's going to be a minute, which actually turns into 10-20 minutes. Just a very frustrating location.

GIFUnpSNIYHOYcklpjBh-g.text: When I lived in Charlotte I was here every week, I swear. Convenient location and nice employees. And of course, sweet tea! Being from Ohio, I thank the gods that every fast food place in the south serves sweet tea. Oh Chipotle. I love you so.
